i1.name: Glory in Death
description: {{sbc|Innate:}} Upon taking {{tip|Death|fatal damage}}, '''Sion''' goes into {{tip|stasis (buff)|stasis}} for {{fd|1.5}} seconds, after which he {{tip|Zombie state|reanimates}} and enters a frenzy, restoring himself to {{sti|health|{{as|100% '''maximum''' health}}}} but [[Health#Health_as_a_casting_resource|losing]] {{as|{{pp|2 to 19}} health}} every {{rutngt|0.25}}, increasing by{{ft|70% of the '''base''' value|{{as|{{pp|2*0.7 to 19*0.7}} health}}}}per subsequent tick.

'''Sion''' can move and use [[basic attack]]s but cannot use [[summoner spell]]s during this time, and attacks at a '''fixed''' {{sti|{{as|{{fd|1.75}} attack speed}}}}, gains {{sti|life steal|100% '''bonus'''}} [[life steal]], deals {{as|10% of the target’s '''maximum''' health}} as {{as|'''bonus''' physical damage}} {{tip|on-hit}}, capped at 75 against non-champions, and is {{tip|ghosted}}.

While ''Glory in Death'' is active, '''Sion's''' {{stil|health regeneration}} and {{tip|heal|healing}} (besides {{stil|life steal}}) are reduced by 100% and all of his [[champion ability|abilities]] are replaced with {{ai|Death Surge|Sion}}.
''If Glory in Death does not end within 60 seconds, '''Sion''' dies instantly.''
i1.descriptionHtml:
Innate: Upon taking fatal damage, Sion goes into stasis for 1.5 seconds, after which he reanimates and enters a frenzy, restoring himself to 100% maximum health but Health#Health_as_a_casting_resource 2undefined − 19undefined (based on level) health every Unknown value: rutngt 0.25, increasing byper subsequent tick.
Sion can move and use basic attacks but cannot use summoner spells during this time, and attacks at a fixed 1.75 attack speed, gains 100% bonus life steal, deals 10% of the target’s maximum health as bonus physical damage on-hit, capped at 75 against non-champions, and is ghosted.
While Glory in Death is active, Sion's Unknown value: stil health regeneration and healing (besides Unknown value: stil life steal) are reduced by 100% and all of his champion ability are replaced with Death Surge.
If Glory in Death does not end within 60 seconds, Sion dies instantly.
i1.notes:
* ''Glory in Death'' is currently the only [[untargetability|targetable]] {{tip|zombie state}}.
* Upon ''Death'', '''Sion''' will drop non-permanent status effects (buffs and debuffs) that do not inherently ''persist through death'' before transitioning into ''Glory in Death'':
** These effects include undisplayed statuses, for example the 'already stunned by this'-flag of {{cai|Event Horizon|Veigar}} or {{cai|Gravity Field|Viktor}}.
** Some [[item]] passives do not persist through death and will be lost for the initial few seconds of ''Glory in Death''.
** An example for a debuff that does persist through death is {{cai|Blaze|Brand}}.
* ''Glory in Death'' will still trigger if '''Sion''' is killed by the {{tip|Nexus Obelisk}}.
* Upon death, the current cooldowns of '''Sion's''' {{ccib|Summoner spell icon.png|summoner spells}} are increased to 4 seconds. Afterwards, he is still unable to use them until he respawns or after a lock-out effect (excluding {{tip|crowd control}} except {{tip|stasis}}) unlocks them.
* {{ai|Chronoshift|Zilean}} and {{ii|Guardian Angel}} will take priority over ''Glory in Death''.
* '''Sion's''' death timer starts ticking when he first {{tip|death|dies}} and not when ''Glory in Death's'' duration ends.
** If '''Sion''' lives longer than his death timer lasts for, he will not revive until ''Glory in Death'' has ended. When it has ended, he will revive instantly, which can result in some odd interactions and bugs at times.
* ''Glory in Death'' does not trigger on [[Decoy|clones]] of '''Sion''', such as with {{ai|Test of Spirit|Illaoi}}.
* ''Glory in Death's'' {{tip|untargetability}} from the {{tip|stasis (buff)|stasis}} does not {{tip|homing projectile destruction|destroy}} in-flight {{tip|projectiles}}.
** Projectiles created while while '''Sion''' is in the zombie form will still travel to him even after he dies.
* At the start of ''Glory in Death'', '''Sion's''' {{tip|mana}} drops to 0, but his {{sti|mana regeneration|{{as|mana regeneration}}}} will remain in effect.
* During ''Glory in Death'' '''Sion''': 
** Has all sources of {{tip|heal|healing}} reduced by 100% with the exception of {{stil|life steal}} and {{stil|spell vamp}}.
*** This includes item passives such as {{iis|Blade of the Ruined King}} special lifesteal-affected on-hit, as well as [[Runes Reforged|runes]] such as {{ri|Ravenous Hunter}}.
*** {{iis|Spirit Visage}} unique passive (specifically before [[V10.23]]) is unaffected and furthermore 'lowers' this reduction to 70% for [[health regeneration]] due to the way it factors in.
** ''Can:''
*** {{tip|critical strike|Critically strike}}.
*** Use all [[Active ability items|item actives]], except {{ii|Refillable Potion}} and {{ii|Corrupting Potion}}.
*** Use {{ai|Magical Journey|Bard}}.
*** Be targeted by {{ai|Stand United|Shen}}.
*** Be dragged and carried by {{ai|Fate's Call|Kalista}}.
**** '''Sion''' will not lose health during this time.
** ''Cannot:''
*** Channel {{si|Recall}}.
*** Enter {{tip|resurrection}} (e.g. via {{ii|Guardian Angel}}).
*** Use {{ccib|Summoner spell icon.png|summoner spells}}.
*** Take {{ai|Abyssal Voyage|Tahm Kench}} nor {{ai|Dark Passage|Thresh}}.
*** Be targeted by {{ai|Chronoshift|Zilean}}, {{ai|Devour|Tahm Kench}}, nor {{ai|Umbral Trespass|Kayn}}.
**** He cannot be targeted by {{ai|Fate's Call|Kalista}} while in the {{tip|stasis (buff)|stasis}} portion of ''Glory in Death'' (if he does, by any circumstance, he will emerge immediately).
*** Be taken into the {{ai|Realm of Death|Mordekaiser}}.
*** Be affected by {{ai|Fear Beyond Death 2|Urgot|Fear Beyond Death}} (recast), {{ai|Curse of the Black Mist|Senna}}, nor {{ai|Lamb's Respite|Kindred}}.
*** Have his spirit be pulled by {{ai|Test of Spirit|Illaoi}}.
*** Pick up the {{ii|Eye of the Herald}}.
*** Take the [[Catapult]].
* Trying to cast item actives during the initial stasis will buffer their casts instead, unless '''Sion''' issues another command before being able to act again.
** Exception: [[File: Quicksilver Sash item.png|20px|link=]] {{nie|Quicksilver}} can be used during the stasis after death.
* '''Sion's''' attack speed during ''Glory in Death'' is fixed at {{fd|1.75}} and it's unaffected by {{as|attack speed}} bonuses and {{tip|cripple|cripples}} for the duration.
** Buffs that allow for the normal {{fd|2.5}} attack speed cap to be surpassed, such as {{ri|Lethal Tempo}} and {{ri|Hail of Blades}}, will also break the upper limit of the {{fd|1.75}} cap, but not the lower one. This means that while these [[buff]]s are active, '''Sion''' can exceed {{fd|1.75}} attack speed, but cannot fall below it.
** After the effect ends, the attack speed cap will not revert to {{fd|1.75}} but to {{fd|2.5}}. However '''Sion''' will still not be able to go below {{as|{{fd|1.75}} attack speed}}.
* Buffs from jungle monsters '''Sion''' gains during ''Glory in Death'' ({{bi|Crest of Cinders}}, {{bi|Crest of Insight}}) will not be lost once the duration ends.
* By surviving for the full duration of 60 seconds, '''Sion''' will have suffered {{as|{{pp|key=k|36.3654 to 345.4713|round=1}}|health}} in health costs.
* After ''Glory in Death'' ends, the corpse of '''Sion''' will retain [[unit collision]] despite being dead on the ground.
* Even though its visuals are present, {{ri|Dark Harvest}} can never be gained from '''Sion''' under the effect of ''Glory in Death''.
* The effect that heals '''Sion''' back to full health at the start of ''Glory in Death'' cannot be modified by {{tip|Grievous Wounds|healing reductions}} and does not count towards the 'Damage Healed' statistic at the end of game lobby.
* ''Glory in Death's'' [[on-hit]] effect also applies against structures other than {{tip|turrets}}. {{bug}}

i2.name: Death Surge
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Sion''' gains {{sti|ms|{{As|50% '''bonus''' movement speed}}}} that decays over {{fd|1.5}} seconds.
''Once at least one ability has been learned, '''Death Surge''' can be cast using any ability key, even for the abilities that haven't been learned yet.''
i2.descriptionHtml:
Active: Sion gains 50% bonus movement speed that decays over 1.5 seconds.
Once at least one ability has been learned, Death Surge can be cast using any ability key, even for the abilities that haven't been learned yet.
i2.notes:
* ''Death Surge's'' will always be ready to use when ''Glory in Death'' triggers.
* ''Death Surge's'' cooldown is affected by [[ability haste]] and thus the spell is technically able to be used up to twice during ''Glory in Death'', but not in practice.
** Despite showing a shorter cooldown when hovering the ability in the ultimate-slot in the HUD, ''Death Surge'' is not actually affected by {{ri|Ultimate Hunter}}.

q1.name: Decimating Smash
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Sion''' {{tip|channel|charges}} for up to 2 seconds to increase ''Decimating Smash's'' {{sti|range}}, {{tip|airborne|knock up}} duration, {{tip|stun}} duration, and damage every {{fd|0.25}} seconds, which has up to a maximum '''bonus''' for the {{as|'''base''' damage|physical damage}} and up to a 200% '''bonus''' for the {{as|'''scaling''' damage|physical damage}}. ''Decimating Smash'' can be recast at any time within its duration, and automatically does so if the charge completes without reactivation.
If the charge is {{tip|interrupt|interrupted}}, ''Decimating Smash'' is put on a 2-second {{sti|cooldown}}.

{{sbc|Recast:}} '''Sion''' flails his axe in the target direction, dealing {{as|physical damage}} to all enemies in the area and {{tip|slow|slowing}} them by 50% for {{fd|0.25}} seconds. ''Decimating Smash'' deals 150% damage against {{tip|monster|monsters}} and 60% damage against {{tip|minion|minions}}.

If ''Decimating Smash'' was charged for at least 1 second, '''Sion''' instead slams his axe down, {{tip|airborne|knocking up}} all enemies within the area for {{pp|type=channel time|0.5 to 1 for 5|1 to 2|formula=0.5+(0.125 every 0.25 seconds). ''Calculation starts at the first second.''|changedisplay = true}} seconds and {{tip|stun|stunning}} them for {{pp|type=channel time|1.25 to 2.25 for 5|1 to 2|formula=1.25+(0.25 every 0.25 seconds). ''Calculation starts at the first second.''|changedisplay = true}} seconds.
q1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Sion charges for up to 2 seconds to increase Decimating Smash's range, knock up duration, stun duration, and damage every 0.25 seconds, which has up to a maximum bonus for the base damage and up to a 200% bonus for the scaling damage. Decimating Smash can be recast at any time within its duration, and automatically does so if the charge completes without reactivation.
If the charge is interrupted, Decimating Smash is put on a 2-second cooldown.
Recast: Sion flails his axe in the target direction, dealing physical damage to all enemies in the area and slowing them by 50% for 0.25 seconds. Decimating Smash deals 150% damage against monsters and 60% damage against minions.
If Decimating Smash was charged for at least 1 second, Sion instead slams his axe down, knocking up all enemies within the area for 1 to 2 ‒ undefined seconds and stunning them for 1 to 2 ‒ undefined seconds.

If their edge also hits the white part of the cone they will be excluded from being hit. Cone is at 16 degrees and starts 800 range behind Sion's center. White cone has a radius of 720, while yellow cone has a radius of 1550.]]
* '''Sion''' himself remains {{tip|lockout|locked out}} of all actions for {{fd|0.25}} seconds when releasing ''Decimating Smash''.
** Trying to cast {{ai|Soul Furnace|Sion}} will buffer the cast until '''Sion''' is no longer locked out or otherwise prevented from casting it, while {{ai|Roar of the Slayer|Sion}} and {{ai|Unstoppable Onslaught|Sion}} will not buffer.
* {{tip|Displacement immunity}} will also resist the application of the {{tip|stun}}.
* Since the {{tip|stun}} duration is longer than the {{tip|airborne}} duration, and both start at the same time, {{tip|Tenacity}} is still fully effective against ''Decimating Smash'' up to a cap.
** This virtual cap is 60%-55.5% {{sti|Tenacity}} based on channel time beyond 1 second. Every value below this cap will lower the CC duration with no diminished returns.
* A flash of the axe and change in brightness of the indicator on the ground indicates when the 1 second time frame is reached.
* The damage of ''Decimating Smash'' is calculated when it is released. Gaining {{as|AD}} or upgrading the ability during its channel will update the damage of the coming hit. 
** Even though the [[cooldown]] starts when the ability is released, it will not be changed by gaining or losing [[Cooldown reduction|CDR]], or upgrading the ability, during the cast time.
* The indicator is visible to the enemy only if they {{tip|Sight|see}} '''Sion''' himself.
** If the channel is released before 1 second, enemies may see a particle at the far end of the hitbox, if it itself isn't outside of their {{tip|Sight|vision}}.
** If the channel is released after 1 second, the only remaining indication is the visual effects and audio that plays on any units the spell strikes (these play on-target), provided the enemy does have {{tip|Sight|vision}} on those.
* Forced movement without a {{tip|stun}} component (or the stun being {{tip|cleanse|cleansed}} previously) will not stop '''Sion''' from starting or continuing to channel. Its direction will not change with '''Sion's''' travel, however the location will update with him.
** The location of the indicator updates at the ''beginning'' of the ability, at ''1 second'' and at ''release''.
* The indicator of the ability is slightly shorter at its front than the hitbox of the ability is for {{csl|Sion}}, {{csl|Sion|Mecha Zero}} and related skins and chromas, while on {{csl|Sion|Worldbreaker}}, the indicator is slightly thinner at the front than the hitbox is, instead.

w1.name: Soul Furnace
description: {{sbc|Passive:}} '''Sion''' gains {{sti|health|{{as|4 '''bonus''' health}}}} whenever he kills an {{tt|enemy|see notes for details}}, increased to {{as|15|health}} against large enemies and for enemy champion {{tip|takedown|takedowns}}.

{{sbc|Active:}} '''Sion''' {{tip|shield|shields}} himself for up to 6 seconds. ''Soul Furnace'' can be recast after 3 seconds while the shield holds, and does so automatically at the end of its duration.
{{sbc|Recast:}} '''Sion''' consumes ''Soul Furnace's'' shield to deal {{as|magic damage}} to all nearby enemies, capped at 400 against minions and monsters.
''Both of Soul Furnace's casts can be activated during '''Sion's''' other abilities, other than the release of {{ai|Q|Sion}}.''
w1.descriptionHtml:
Passive: Sion gains 4 bonus health whenever he kills an enemy, increased to 15 against large enemies and for enemy champion takedowns.
Active: Sion shields himself for up to 6 seconds. Soul Furnace can be recast after 3 seconds while the shield holds, and does so automatically at the end of its duration.
Recast: Sion consumes Soul Furnace's shield to deal magic damage to all nearby enemies, capped at 400 against minions and monsters.
Both of Soul Furnace's casts can be activated during Sion's other abilities, other than the release of Q.
leveling: {{st|Magic Damage|{{ap|40 to 140}} {{as|(+ 40% AP)}} {{as|(+ {{ap|10 to 14}}% of target's '''maximum''' health)}}}}
w1.notes:
* A buff icon in the HUD will show the current shield strength, so that the player can better calculate the timing of the second cast.
** The initial shown value does not interact with {{sti|Heal and Shield Power|shield strength modifiers|link=true}}. Whenever the shield takes damage, it updates to the proper current shield amount, however.
*The initial cast counts as an ability activation for the purposes of on-cast effects such as {{tip|Spellblade}} and stacking {{ai|Force Pulse|Kassadin}}.
**Detonating the ability manually does not.
* Gaining or losing AP or health, or ranking up the skill while the shield is active will not change its shield value but it will change the damage of the shield's detonation.
* The [[cooldown]] of ''Soul Furnace'' begins once the shield is removed.
** Gaining or losing {{sti|ability haste}} between the first cast and breaking of the shield will affect the resuming cooldown accordingly.
* ''Soul Furnace'' also automatically detonates if '''Sion''' is killed without the shield being destroyed, e.g. by dying to the {{tip|Nexus Obelisk}}, ''even if'' Sion could not have detonated it manually yet.
* ''Soul Furnace's'' bonus health can be obtained by any of '''Sion's''' damage sources (basic attacks, abilities, summoner spells, item actives).
** This does not include ''last hits'' transferred to '''Sion''' artificially, through effects such as {{ii|Relic Shield|Spoils of War}}.
** If the [[gold efficiency]] of a {{ii|Ruby Crystal}} is considered 100%, each ''last hit'' or {{tip|takedown|''takedown''}} after ''Soul Furnace'' has been learned can be considered worth an extra {{g|{{fd|10.{{recurring|6}}}}}} or {{g|40g}}.
* '''Sion''' must learn ''Soul Furnace'' before he can stack up its passive.
* '''Sion''' does not gain bonus health from units that enter {{tip|resurrection}} on-death.
* Killing the following unit types grants '''Sion''' {{as|15 '''bonus''' health}}:
** {{tip|champion|Champions}} ([[kill]]s and [[assist]]s)
** {{tip|minion|Large minions}} and {{tip|monster|large monsters}} (including both summoned and pit {{ui|Rift Herald}})
** {{tip|pet|Large pets}} - Explicitly {{ai|Summon: Tibbers|Annie|Tibbers}}, {{ai|Daisy!|Ivern|Daisy}} and {{ai|Eulogy of the Isles|Yorick|The Maiden}}
* Killing the following unit types grants '''Sion''' {{as|4 '''bonus''' health}}:
** {{tip|Minions}} and {{tip|monster|small monsters}}
** {{tip|Wards}} and other [[champion summoned units]] (e.g. {{ai|Noxious Trap|Teemo}}, {{ai|Powder Keg|Gangplank}}, {{ai|Dark Procession|Yorick}})
** All {{tip|pet|pets}}, with the exceptions of those listed above and below
** {{tip|Clone|Clones}}
* Killing the following unit types grants '''Sion''' ''no'' {{as|'''bonus''' health}}:
** {{tip|Turrets}} (including {{ai|Shurima's Legacy|Azir|Sun Disk}}) and other [[structures]]
** [[Jungle plants]] (destroying which does not grant kill credit).
** Units destroyed by 'trampling' such as {{cai|Rampant Growth|Zyra|seeds}}, {{cai|Cell Division|Zac|goo}} or {{cai|Tunnel|Rek'Sai|tunnels}}.

e1.name: Roar of the Slayer
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Sion''' bellows in the target direction, dealing {{as|magic damage}} to the first enemy hit, {{tip|slow|slowing}} them for {{fd|2.5}} seconds, and {{sti|armor penetration|{{as|reducing their armor by 20%}}}} for 4 seconds.

If the target is a {{tip|minion}} or non-epic {{tip|monster}}, it is {{tip|stun|stunned}} for {{fd|0.75}} seconds and {{tip|airborne|knocked back}}, in the same line, up to 1350 units away from '''Sion''', dealing the same damage and applying the same effects to all enemies it passes through as well as briefly granting {{tip|sight}} of the area it travels. Shoved enemies are immune to minion damage and take their damage once they are stopped if they would die to ''Roar of the Slayer's'' damage, by either colliding with terrain, reaching the end of their trajectory, or having its displacement interrupted.
e1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Sion bellows in the target direction, dealing magic damage to the first enemy hit, slowing them for 2.5 seconds, and reducing their armor by 20% for 4 seconds.
If the target is a minion or non-epic monster, it is stunned for 0.75 seconds and knocked back, in the same line, up to 1350 units away from Sion, dealing the same damage and applying the same effects to all enemies it passes through as well as briefly granting sight of the area it travels. Shoved enemies are immune to minion damage and take their damage once they are stopped if they would die to Roar of the Slayer's damage, by either colliding with terrain, reaching the end of their trajectory, or having its displacement interrupted.
e1.notes:
* Unlike the intial single-target [[projectile]], a thrown minion or monster is not blocked by {{ai|Wind Wall|Yasuo}} or {{ai|Unbreakable|Braum}}.
* Gaining or losing {{as|AP}}, or upgrading the ability while its projectile is traveling will change its damage for every future hit. This applies to both the intial single-target projectile, as well as the minion-projectile.
* ''Roar of the Slayer'' will cast from wherever '''Sion''' is at the end of the cast time.

r1.name: Unstoppable Onslaught
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Sion''' becomes {{tip|Cc-immune|immune to crowd control}} and {{tip|ghosted}} and, after a {{rutngt|0.05}} delay, {{tip|channel|charges}} forward in the direction of the cursor for up to 8 seconds, during which he is able to steer at a slow turn rate while automatically navigating his movement. ''Unstoppable Onslaught'' can be recast after {{tt|{{fd|0.4}}|Estimated}} seconds during the channel.

The charge uses '''Sion's''' {{tt|{{as|movement speed}}|Post movement speed caps}} at the time of cast and is unaffected by external sources for the duration, including [[Movement_speed#Movement_speed_caps|movement speed caps]], while also gaining {{sti|ms|{{as|40 '''bonus''' movement speed}}}} every {{fd|0.1}} seconds, up to {{as|950 '''total''' movement speed}}.

At the end of the charge's duration, '''Sion''' {{tip|lunge|leaps}} forward {{tt|300|Can end up being slightly shorter, but not related to to Sion's speed}}-units, landing after {{fd|0.55}} seconds and slamming the {{tt|ground|500 range, estimated}} beneath him. '''Sion''' will stop upon {{tt|colliding|150 units in front of Sion for the charge and point blank for the leap}} with an enemy champion or {{tt|terrain|Includes structures, read notes for details on player-generated terrain}} during the charge, slamming instantly and ending ''Unstoppable Onslaught'' prematurely. Crashing into terrain will cause '''Sion''' to {{tip|stun}} himself for {{fd|0.5}} seconds.

Enemies struck by '''Sion's''' charge are dealt {{as|physical damage}}. The '''base''' damage increases by {{pp|type=channel time|changedisplay=true|key=%|0 to 500/3 for 4|0 to 3|formula=55.55% every 1 second. ''This is capped at 3 seconds.''}} and the {{sti|{{as|'''bonus''' AD}}}} ratio increases by {{pp|type=channel time|changedisplay=true|key=%|0 to 100 for 4|0 to 3|formula=33.33% every 1 second. ''This is capped at 3 seconds.''}}.

Enemies, including {{tip|turret|turrets}}, within the slam are dealt the same {{as|physical damage}} and are {{tip|slow|slowed}} for 3 seconds, and those in close proximity of '''Sion''' are also {{tip|airborne|knocked up}} for {{pp|type=channel time|label1=seconds|changedisplay=true|0.75 to 1.75|0 to 3 by 1}} seconds and after a brief delay become {{tip|stun|stunned}} for the same duration. If '''Sion''' collides with an enemy champion, all {{tt|nearby|350 range, estimated}} enemies are additionally {{tip|airborne|pulled}} towards him over {{fd|0.5}} seconds and after a brief delay become {{tip|stun|stunned}} for {{pp|type=channel time|label1=seconds|changedisplay=true|0.25 to 1.75|0 to 3 by 1}} seconds, increased to {{pp|type=channel time|label1=seconds|changedisplay=true|0.75 to 1.75|0 to 3 by 1}} if they were hit by the leap.
r1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Sion becomes immune to crowd control and ghosted and, after a Unknown value: rutngt 0.05 delay, charges forward in the direction of the cursor for up to 8 seconds, during which he is able to steer at a slow turn rate while automatically navigating his movement. Unstoppable Onslaught can be recast after 0.4 seconds during the channel.
The charge uses Sion's movement speed at the time of cast and is unaffected by external sources for the duration, including Movement_speed#Movement_speed_caps, while also gaining 40 bonus movement speed every 0.1 seconds, up to 950 total movement speed.
At the end of the charge's duration, Sion leaps forward 300-units, landing after 0.55 seconds and slamming the ground beneath him. Sion will stop upon colliding with an enemy champion or terrain during the charge, slamming instantly and ending Unstoppable Onslaught prematurely. Crashing into terrain will cause Sion to stun himself for 0.5 seconds.
Enemies struck by Sion's charge are dealt physical damage. The base damage increases by 0 to 3 ‒ undefined and the bonus AD ratio increases by 0 to 3 ‒ undefined.
Enemies, including turrets, within the slam are dealt the same physical damage and are slowed for 3 seconds, and those in close proximity of Sion are also knocked up for 0 to 3 by 1 ‒ undefined seconds and after a brief delay become stunned for the same duration. If Sion collides with an enemy champion, all nearby enemies are additionally pulled towards him over 0.5 seconds and after a brief delay become stunned for 0 to 3 by 1 ‒ undefined seconds, increased to 0 to 3 by 1 ‒ undefined if they were hit by the leap.
leveling: {{st|Minimum Physical Damage|{{ap|150|300|450}} {{as|(+ 40% '''bonus''' AD)}}|Maximum Physical Damage|{{ap|400|800|1200}} {{as|(+ 80% '''bonus''' AD)}}}}
r1.notes:
* When '''Sion''' casts ''Unstoppable Onslaught'' a global warning can be heard.
* ''Unstoppable Onslaught'' does not apply the knock up nor stun to enemies from slamming on collision with terrain.
* ''Unstoppable Onslaught'' does not {{tip|airborne|knock up}} non-champions hit by the charge.{{bug}}
* ''Unstoppable Onslaught'' can be activated twice '''or''' held down and released on '''both''' normal cast and quick cast. There is no other difference between normal cast and quick cast for this ability, either.
*The initial cast counts as an ability activation for the purposes of on-cast effects such as {{tip|Spellblade}} and stacking {{ai|Force Pulse|Kassadin}}.
**The recast does not.
* An enemy can only be affected by ''Unstoppable Onslaught'' once every 1 second.
* After reaching maximum damage and stun duration (at 3 seconds) '''Sion''' will transition from using his ''haste'' animation to his unique ''charging'' one.
** Reaching the threshold on {{csl|Sion|Mecha Zero}} changes his particle effects instead, most notably the 'Boosters' behind the vehicle.
** The turning angle is not based on time and can easily be seen in practice when a '''Sion''' ''charges'' in-place due to bugs.
* {{cai|I|Nami}} is the only known effect that can affect '''Sion's''' {{as|movement speed}} during the ''charge'' and that can place him above the normal MS value. However, without further multipliers, surpassing the {{as|950 movement speed}} cap will require {{ci|Nami}} to have over {{as|2150 ability power}}.
* '''Sion''' does not always crash with terrain immediately upon touching it, enabling the player to turn beyond his maximum turning angle.
** Casting the ability at point blank of a terrain will most often automatically change the ''charge's'' direction.
** This is not usually possible with player-generated terrain.
* ''Unstoppable Onslaught'' cannot ''charge'' through but can ''leap'' over player-created terrain (i.e {{ai|Crystallize|Anivia}}).
* '''Sion''' loses the {{tip|cc-immune|crowd control immunity}} after finishing the {{tip|lunge|leap}}.
* '''Sion''' is not immune to {{tip|crowd control}} applied by his allies during ''Unstoppable Onslaught''. For example, a {{ui|Blast Cone}} triggered by an ally will cause the {{tip|channel}} to be {{tip|interrupt|interrupted}}.
** An allied {{cai|Tempered Fate|Bard}} will be resisted however.
*** If it hits '''Sion''' during the {{fd|0.05}}-second delay before he starts the channel, he will not resist the effect and will initiate the ''slam'' immediately while in {{tip|stasis}}.
* '''Sion''' is immune to the {{ai|Realm of Death|Mordekaiser}} for 2 seconds after completing the slam after the channel ends.{{bug}}
* ''Unstoppable Onslaught'' {{tt|cannot strike the same non-champion twice in less than 1 second|Like most AOE spells or spells with traveling hitboxes, it places a marker buff on struck targets. This one lasts 1 second}}.
* {{Pending for test}} The distance between '''Sion's''' center and the center of the ground ''slam'' scales slightly with movement speed. This is suspected because running into a wall within half a second of ''charge'' time after starting at multiple thousands of movement speed shows a considerable difference, however this could also be due to a bug.
* {{Pending for test}} The ''leap'' appears to always have the same speed regardless of '''Sion's''', at roughly 750.
* Moving the cursor onto HUD elements (e.g [[Map (League of Legends)|mini map]] / champion portraits) does ''not'' jeopardize the cast and steering of ''Unstoppable Onslaught''. The targeting will act as if the ground was targeted below the display element.
* Even though the [[cooldown]] of ''Unstoppable Onslaught'' starts at the end of the effect, gaining or losing [[ability haste]], or upgrading the ability during the effect, will not change the resuming cooldown.
* {{tip|Cleanse|Removing}} the {{tip|airborne}} before {{fd|0.5}} seconds will '''not''' prevent the {{tip|stun}} from being applied.
* {{tip|Displacement immunity}} will also resist the application of the {{tip|stun}}.
* The following table refers for interactions while '''Sion''' is {{tip|channel|channeling}}:
{{ct|channel|attack=false|move=Allowed, but cannot input movement commands.|cast= {{ai|Soul Furnace|Sion}} and its {{ai|Soul Furnace 2|Sion|recast}} are usable. {{ai|Decimating Smash|Sion}} and {{ai|Roar of the Slayer|Sion}} are disabled. This ability recasts to end channel.|items=false|consume=false|spells=false|interrupts=death}}
* If ''Unstoppable Onslaught's'' channel is interrupted despite the immunity to crowd control or {{ai|Decimating Smash|Sion}} is cast within {{fd|0.25}} seconds after starting the charge, it will also initiate the leap. If the channel ends due to collision or death, there is no {{tip|lunge|leap}} and the effect occurs immediately.
